add(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object).Description: Offer value for possible inclusion if this cursor defines the given column. Columns not defined by the cursor are silently ignored.
add(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object).FullName: public MatrixCursor.RowBuilder add (String columnName, Object value)

Throws: if you try to add too many values
add(java.lang.Object).Description: Sets the next column value in this row.

add(java.lang.String,java.lang.Object).Description: Offer value for possible inclusion if this cursor defines the given column. Columns not defined by the cursor are silently ignored.
add(java.lang.String,java.lang.Object).FullName: public MatrixCursor.RowBuilder add (String columnName, Object value)

ClassDesc: Builds a row of values using either of these approaches: Values can be added with explicit column ordering using @B_android#database#MatrixCursor#RowBuilder#add_E@, which starts from the left-most column and adds one column value at a time. This follows the same ordering as the column names specified at cursor construction time. Column and value pairs can be offered for possible inclusion using @B_android#database#MatrixCursor#RowBuilder#add_E@. If the cursor includes the given column, the value will be set for that column, otherwise the value is ignored. This approach is useful when matching data to a custom projection. Undefined values are left as null.
